path: Secondary Sources/Jenkins, John L./Knowledge and Faith in Thomas Aquinas/02 - Scientia and sacred doctrine/Jenkins.J._KFTA_02:  58
title: Jenkins.J._KFTA_02:  58
text: according to the rule and measure of this "higher" light 97 Read more at location 2197 Note: This lumen gratiae looks a lot like Augustine to me. It looks like immediacy. Could this be what Hooker is describing?

path: Secondary Sources/Jenkins, John L./Knowledge and Faith in Thomas Aquinas/02 - Scientia and sacred doctrine/Jenkins.J._KFTA_02:  59
title: Jenkins.J._KFTA_02:  59
text: in terms of merely human nature and the light of reason,Read more at location 2215 Note: I wonder if this distinction between the light of reason and the light of grace is what we see in Hooker rather than Augustinian immediacy plus angelic hierarchy Edit
